bug.author: bdewilde
bug.description:
I'm getting a strange error on v2.0.4 that I did not get on v2.0.3, but haven't yet been able to diagnose. Am also having a hard time reproducing it in a simple, isolated way, so apologies for the vague submission. One error happens when I try to deepcopy a Doc, and a similar one happens when I try to add pipes to a spacy Language. Here's a traceback: <denchmark-code> File "/home/travis/build/chartbeat-labs/textacy/textacy/corpus.py", line 237, in load spacy_lang.add_pipe(spacy_lang.create_pipe(name)) File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python2.7.13/lib/python2.7/site-packages/spacy/language.py", line 217, in create_pipe return factory(self, **config) File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python2.7.13/lib/python2.7/site-packages/spacy/language.py", line 102, in <lambda> 'tagger': lambda nlp, **cfg: Tagger(nlp.vocab, **cfg), File "pipeline.pyx", line 376, in spacy.pipeline.Tagger.__init__ AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'data' </denchmark-code>
Similarly, here's the tail end of the deepcopy traceback: <denchmark-code> File "nn_parser.pyx", line 315, in spacy.syntax.nn_parser.Parser.__init__ AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'data' </denchmark-code>
The most puzzling aspect is that I can run the same code successfully in v2.0.3, so either something changed on your side, or I'm doing something very dumb. Thanks in advance for helping me figure out which. :) <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.0.4 Platform: Darwin-16.7.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.6.0 Models: de, de_core_news_sm, en, en_core_web_sm, es, es_core_news_sm

comments.comment: Ah, so sorry about this ‚Äì this seems to be related to a bug we intended to fix in v2.0.4 (but didn't ‚Äì¬†instead, it ended up still broken, but different). So we pushed another fix earlier. Can you try again with v2.0.5? Problem in a nutshell: The vectors didn't pickle correctly and ended up being deserialized as zeros. Unfortunately, the fix contained a bug, so the vectors then became None, which causes errors like the one above when trying to access vocab.vectors.data.
Aha! That explains why this started working 10 minutes ago, when I updated to v2.0.5. üòÅ Thanks, Ines!
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
